results.title: Paderewski playing his Minuet followed by Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata
results.brief_description: The famous pianist, Paderewski, plays Beethoven’s Nocturne in C sharp minor, Opus 27 (better known as the “Moonlight Sonata”), and his own composition, Paderewski’s Minuet in G. Contains interesting footage of the audience and the wonderful “art deco” venue.
results.title_for_label: Paderewski playing his Minuet followed by Beethoven’s Moonlight Sonata

results.title: Paddle to the sea
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: A children’s odyssey, from the story by Holling C. Holling. A film about a little Indian in a canoe, hand-carved in the northern forest and, in the spring, launched towards the sea. There are many adventures, all photographed with great patience and an eye for the beauty of living things. The film gives vivid impressions of Canada’s varied landscape and the life of its waterways. Commentary by Stanley Jackson. Awards: ten awards including Philadelphia; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.

results.title: Paddington lace
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Bairstow and Chris McCullough
results.brief_description: Paddington is one of Sydney’s oldest suburbs, which has developed somewhat along the lines of New York’s Greenwich Village or London’s Chelsea and has become Sydney’s artist colony. This is a fully dramatised film, which captures the essence of Paddington, not only by striking visuals of the Old-Sydney architecture in the area, but by re-enacting the mood and lifestyle of some typical, bohemian inhabitants. Scripted by Joan Long. Music by Grahame Bond and Rory O’Donaghue. Starring Ross Thompson, Janne Wesley and Ron Blanchard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Bairstow and Chris McCullough

results.title: Paddington goes to the movies (K)
results.creator_credit: Paddington, FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck and Barry Leith
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington goes to the movies
results.creator_credit: Paddington, FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck and Barry Leith
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Narrated by Michael Hordern and based on the book by Michael Bond. results.title: Paddington for Prime Minister; Fishing for Paddington; Expedition Paddington
results.brief_description: Three animated stories about Paddington Bear. Paddington decides that he will toss his floppy hat into the political arena in “Paddington for Prime Minister”. Next, it’s off to the seaside in “Fishing for Paddington”. Then, only Paddington could turn a simple Brown family outing into a raging three ring circus in “Expedition Paddington”. Based on the beloved books by Michael Bond and features the voice of Tim Curry. All episodes are written by Bruce Morris with the exception of “Fishing for Paddington” which was written by Gordon Kent.

results.title: Paddington cleans up (K)
results.brief_description: Adapted from Chapter 2 from the book “Paddington on Top” by Michael Bond. Charming animated tale about neighbourhood free-loader, Mr Curry, plotting to have Paddington clean his house for free. However his plans come unstuck when Paddington is unable to locate a power point for his vacuum cleaner.
